record.title: ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, JULY 13, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, JULY 13, 2007 -- (Senate - July 12, 2007)

[Page: S9186]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9 a.m., Friday, July 13; that on Friday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired and the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that the Senate then resume consideration of H.R. 1585 and conduct debate on the Dorgan amendment, No. 2135, as amended, until 9:30 a.m.; that the Senate proceed to vote in relation to the amendment at 9:30 without further intervening action or debate; and that of the time available until then, Senators DORGAN and SUNUNU each control 10 minutes.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: If there is no further business today, I now ask unanimous consent the Senate stand adjourned under the previous order.

record.narrative: There being no objection, the Senate, at 7:06 p.m., adjourned until Friday, July 13, 2007, at 9 a.m.
